elements.name: question1
elements.title: b)	Which two steps should be completed first when applying for a job?
elements.correctAnswer: Clarify needs and assess your own skills

elements.name: question7
elements.title: c)	Why should you prepare for a few questions before a possible job interview?
elements.correctAnswer: This prepares you for a possible telephone or video interview.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: d)	Who is usually responsible for the recruitment process?
elements.correctAnswer: the personnel department (HR) and the responsible line/department

elements.name: question3
elements.title: e)	In addition to language skills and IT application skills, what other skills can be demonstrated in the application letter?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: f)	What should you pay attention to in the first sentence of an application letter?
elements.correctAnswer: The first sentence should begin with a form of address (you, your, yours, yours).

elements.name: question6
elements.title: g)	What does the middle section of the application letter begin with?
elements.correctAnswer: with the description of the current activity

elements.name: question2
elements.title: h)	How are the individual sections of an application letter visually separated from each other?

elements.name: question21
elements.title: i)	What is the advantage of short sentences in the active form?
elements.correctAnswer: They are easier to understand and appear more dynamic.

elements.name: question22
elements.title: j)	With which spelling of personal names are there no incorrect forms?

elements.title: l)	Which two quality requirements apply to the photo on the CV?
elements.correctAnswer: It must be up-to-date and of professional quality.
